description:
Mathematics is the best known but least understood subject. It plays a
fundamental role in the development of science, technology and society but it
has received little public recognition and is often misused or wrongly perceived
as not useful in life. The seminar module will expose students to various views
on the nature of mathematics, the enterprise called mathematics and its role in
the development of science, technology and society. The module will also focus
on specific topics or issues in science, technology and society where
mathematics have significant impact, such the 2007 financial crisis, the internet,
digital age, electronic commerce, epidemics and so forth. The topics and issues
may be introduced by the lecturer or identified by the students. The students
may focus on aspects of a topic that they are most interested in and at a
mathematical level that they are comfortable with depending on their
background. The mathematics would be elementary and mostly algorithmic and
discrete in the beginning and will move gently up to a level, which may be
different for different students.
title: FS: Mathematics in Science, Technology & Society
